sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Lévy C curve.
message_1: What is the fractal dimension of the Lévy C curve, which has a self-similarity ratio of 1/3 and starts with a line segment of length 1?
message_2:
The fractal dimension (D) of a self-similar curve can be calculated using the formula:

D = log(N) / log(S)

where N is the number of self-similar pieces and S is the self-similarity ratio.

For the Lévy C curve, it is composed of 4 self-similar pieces (N = 4) and has a self-similarity ratio of 1/3 (S = 1/3).

So, the fractal dimension D can be calculated as:

D = log(4) / log(1/3)

D ≈ 1.2619

Therefore, the fractal dimension of the Lévy C curve is approximately 1.2619.
